item.title: The Dark Side of Spectrum Renewal
item.description:
Half a century ago, the government embraced urban renewal, demolishing and rebuilding deteriorated urban areas for housing projects or highways leading to suburbs. Similarly, today, we’re witnessing “spectrum renewal,” where sections of the radio frequency spectrum are deemed too valuable for older technologies like analog TV and cell phone service, despite their widespread use. This isn’t driven by lack of public demand. Millions of analog TV sets and cell phones are still functional...
